pull.title: Avoid locking mutexes that are already held by the same thread
pull.body: Avoid locking mutexes that are already held by the same thread. These are reentrant mutexes, but still no need to lock them more than once per thread :-)

events.body:
utACK 9f857d5.

Are these random picks? For instance, `CTxMemPool::CalculateMemPoolAncestors` can assert the lock too right?
Why would we need the runtime check when there is a compile time check?

@promag No, these are not random picks. They were the ones I could find, verify manually and passes both `make check` + `test/functional/test_runner.py` with nothing but trivial changes :-)

The lock in `CTxMemPool::UpdateTransactionsFromBlock` you suggested could also be removed but that would require more fine grained locking in the corresponding tests. If you have time then please post a diff of that locking change and I'll make it part of this PR :-)
@MarcoFalke I replaced the `LOCK(…);` with `AssertLockHeld(…);` to make it easy to verify also for reviewers not building with Clang thread safety analysis warnings enabled. Should I remove them? :-)
@promag Do you have any additional suggestions beyond `CTxMemPool::CalculateMemPoolAncestors(…)`? :-)

I think it is fine to leave them for now, but it seems arbitrary to add run time checks to a subset of methods that already have the compile time check. I know that not everyone compiles with clang, but at least for releases we do and I am sure some developers build with clang, so it should be noticed quickly.
I wasn't suggesting to remove more locks. Maybe these changes are preferable in small PR's.

Added the `removeConflicts(…) EXCLUSIVE_LOCKS_REQUIRED(…)` annotation to `txmempool.h`. 

@promag Would you mind re-reviewing?
@theuni @promag @MarcoFalke Updated to address feedback. Please re-review :-)

issue.title: [WIP] Add Clang thread safety analysis annotations: GUARDED_BY(lock) / EXCLUSIVE_LOCKS_REQUIRED(lock)
issue.body:
Add additional Clang thread safety analysis annotations as discussed with @sipa (https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/10866#issuecomment-316238630) and others.

This is a follow-up to #10866 ~~which this PR is rebased upon (awaiting merge of #10866). The first three commits (8a1dc09, e022990 and cbae151) can be reviewed in #10866.~~

This PR contains three types of changes:
1. Add missing locks (based on the `GUARDED_BY(...)` analysis below). Please review thoroughly.
2. Add `GUARDED_BY(...)` annotations to allow for Clang's thread safety analysis at compile-time. Does not change run-time behaviour.
3. Add `EXCLUSIVE_LOCKS_REQUIRED(...)` annotations to allow for Clang's thread safety analysis at compile-time. Does not change run-time behaviour.

Background reading: The ["C/C++ Thread Safety Analysis"](https://research.google.com/pubs/archive/42958.pdf) paper (Hutchins, Ballman & Sutherland, 2014) paper describing Clang thread safety analysis and how it is used for the Google C++ codebase:

> They essentially provide a static type system for threads, and can detect potential race conditions and deadlocks. This paper describes Clang Thread Safety Analysis, a tool which uses annotations to declare and enforce thread safety policies in C and C++ programs.
> […]
> It has been deployed on a large scale at Google; all C++ code at Google is now compiled with thread safety analysis enabled by default.
> […]
> The `GUARDED_BY` attribute declares that a thread must lock `mu` before it can read or write to `balance`, thus ensuring that the increment and decrement operations are atomic. Similarly, `REQUIRES` declares that the calling thread must lock mu before calling `withdrawImpl`. Because the caller is assumed to have locked `mu,` it is safe to modify `balance` within the body of the method.

issue.title: Meta-issue: Add Clang thread safety analysis annotations
issue.body:
This meta-issue tracks the status of the Clang thread safety analysis PRs.

- [x] Fix `-Wthread-safety-analysis` warnings. Compile with `-Wthread-safety-analysis` if available. (#10866)
- [x] travis: Build with `--enable-werror` under OS X (#10923)
- [x] net: Add missing lock in `ProcessHeadersMessage(...)` (#11578)
- [x] addrman: Add missing lock in `Clear()` (CAddrMan) (#11585)
- [x] rpc: Lock `cs_main` in `blockToJSON`/`blockheaderToJSON` (#11618)
- [x] Avoid lock: Call `FlushStateToDisk(...)` regardless of `fCheckForPruning` (#11617)
- [x] tests: Add missing locks to tests (#11623)
- [x] Add missing `cs_wallet`/`cs_KeyStore` locks to wallet (#11634)
- [ ] Add missing locks: `validation.cpp` + related (#11652)
- [x] mempool: Fix missing locking in `CTxMemPool::check(…)` and `CTxMemPool::setSanityCheck(…)` (#11689)
- [x] qt: Remove redundant locks (#11733)
- [x] net: Add missing locks in `net.{cpp,h}` (#11744)
- [x] Avoid locking mutexes that are already held by the same thread (#11762)
- [x] net: Avoid locking `cs_vNodes` twice when calling `FindNode(...)`. Add `NodeExists(...)` (#11795)
- [x] tests: Make `test_bitcoin` pass under ThreadSanitzer (`clang`). Fix lock-order-inversion (potential deadlock). (#12882)
- [x] Add compile time checking for all `cs_KeyStore` runtime locking assertions (#13077)
- [x] mempool: Add compile time checking for all `::mempool.cs` runtime locking assertions (#13080)
- [x] wallet: Add compile time checking for all `cs_wallet` runtime locking assertions (#13081)
- [x] Add compile time checking for all `cs_main` runtime locking assertions (#13083)
- [x] wallet/keystore: Add Clang thread safety annotations for variables guarded by `cs_KeyStore` (#13114)
- [x] addrman: Add Clang thread safety annotations for variables guarded by `cs_addrMan` (#13115)
- [x] Add Clang thread safety annotations for variables guarded by `cs_{rpcWarmup,nTimeOffset,warnings}` (#13116)
- [x] net: Add Clang thread safety annotations for guarded variables in the networking code (#13123)
- [x] scheduler: Add Clang thread safety annotations for variables guarded by `m_cs_callbacks_pending` (#13125)
- [x] util: Add Clang thread safety annotations for variables guarded by `cs_args` (#13126)
- [x] wallet: Add Clang thread safety annotations for variables guarded by `cs_db` (#13127)
- [x] policy: Add Clang thread safety annotations for variables guarded by `cs_feeEstimator` (#13128)
- [x] Move `cs_main` locking annotations from `.cpp` to `.h` (#14063)
- [x] tests: Add missing locking annotations and locks (`g_cs_orphans`) (#14108)
- [x] Add compile time checking for `cs_main` locks which we assert at run time (#14444)

issue.title: Bitcoin 0.17 locking PRs
issue.body:
These are locking changes from upstream (bitcoin core) release 0.17 (Feb 16, 2018 to Aug 13, 2018), oldest to newest (when merged to the master branch).

This PR is complete and ready for review.

Each commit also includes a reference both to the PR and the upstream commit.

PRs and when each was merged to master:

- https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/11041 Mar 13, 2018
  - Excluding the last commit.
- https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/11617 Apr 11, 2018
- https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/12988 Apr 17, 2018
- https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/12639 May 3, 2018
  - Excluding the second commit (we've removed accounts).
- https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/11689 May 14, 2018
  - Excluding thread safety annotations on code we don't have.
- https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/13023 May 16, 2018
  - Excluding the unit tests commit.
- https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/13114 Jul 11, 2018
  - Second commit doesn't apply, we've changed our code
- https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/11762 Jul 22, 2018
- https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/13423 Jul 26, 2018
  - First commit was cherry-picked in #5057.

labels.name: C-upstream-port
labels.description: Category: Changes that are ported from the Bitcoin Core codebase.

labels.name: I-race
labels.description: Problems and improvements related to race conditions.

comments.body:
Adding this only in the .cpp means that the lock requirement will only be enforced for other functions in this file.

I realize that it can't be added in the header as-is due to the circular dependency, but that needs to be fixed somehow.
No need for the dupe here, header is enough.
@theuni Yes, I'd like to put the annotation in the header file but I need help with resolving the circular dependency. What would be the cleanest way to solve it? :-)
I'm afraid I don't see a simple solution :(

This will no longer compile due to the missing lock annotation in the header.

Could just remove it for now?
